Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2012 04:34PM - edited Mar 28, 2012 04:48PM by Shellusea Hi JCB,  I had my first Navelbine last Thursday, and everything was tolerable until late Saturday - I had so much jaw pain, I tought I was going to loose all my teeths!  Sunday I had to stay in bed all day trying to calm down cause I was afraid it was a heart attack.  Pain was going from the jaw to the neck to the collarbone and to the middle of my chest.  Stayed in bed until Monday afternoon.  Since then, I am emergin from this pain. and now looking with aprehensiveness to my tomorrow next dose...  I am planning having a serious talk to my onc.  Heard this happen to less than 5%....  I too count every minutes before taking pain pills (Tramadol) - that are not effective on the jaw, but at least helps with lung and bones pain. The point to remember is since late Monday I also have less shortness of breast and my lung don't do anymore that awfull noise.  ...  So maybe it worth it.
Posts.Title: Need Info on Navelbine LuAnnH jcb51

Posts.Content: May 16, 2012 04:16AM Shellusea wrote: Had the first Navelbine at 60mg, they lower the next week dose twice (1 for too much s/e and 2 wbc too low) so I received 40mg. Had one week off. Chemo no3 was posponed due to low wbc. I'm now at chemo no.5 after another treatment postponed (wbc was .37). But since no.3 I receive 50mg. In resume I had 60, 40, 50, 50 and this week should be 50 too. Two days after the dose I am like Rakulinda -cannot do nothing exept minimal- for 4 days because of pain and fatigue and also depression. But it seems to work, as since the beginning I have less pain due to bone and my breathing improved. Also have Herceptin every 3 weeks and Aredia once a month.
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2012 05:36PM Shellusea wrote: Scan done in May showed clear head, and the 4.5x4.6cm mass in lung isn't there anymore, all affected nodes shrunk...  and no further new lights.   Perfect for me particularly that I am now use to the chemo, and fell ok even the days after treatmets.  :)
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2010 01:58PM Shellusea wrote: At that age they don't need long answer, but you can also add if he comes back, that you don't think it will be soon and that you still want to be with him for a long time. Tell him that if he has any question not to be shy to come and ask you (or his father), that you are the one who will answer the questions.  Sometime friends of family may say things that will come to his ear and may scare or may think something wrong.   (Hugs)!
Posts.Title: My 4 year old son's questions about dying....breaks my heart lorieg lorieg
